title: Early Complete Molecular Response to First-Line Nilotinib in Two Patients with Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Carrying the p230 Transcript
patient: The second patient, a 41-year-old woman, was diagnosed with chronic phase CML in November 2010. Her blood examination showed the following hematological parameters: Hb 12.5 g/dL, WBC 60 × 109/L, and platelets 1796 × 109/L. The classic Ph karyotype was confirmed in all the metaphases. RT-PCR detected the presence of the e19a2 transcript. After starting frontline treatment with nilotinib 600 mg per day, the patient achieved CCyR and CMR in 6 and 8 months, respectively. Currently, after 30 months, she is well and in CMR.
